channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15614] Report metrics from JvmPauseMonitor
item.description: We have JvmPauseMonitor for detecting JVM pauses; pauses are logged at WARN. Would also be good to expose this information on a dashboard via metrics system – make it easier to get this info off the host and into a central location for the operator.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Could you look at JVM GC metrics instead? Has pause time by generation and overall pause time.

Maybe? The pause monitor thread is reporting 2-3sec pauses that I'm not seeing in my GC metrics. Will look a bit deeper and circle back. GC metrics wouldn't report pauses such as this ugly one; presumably our JvmPauseMonitor would catch this.

Yes please. I was thinking about this as well. We need how many times we paused and for how long according to the JVM pause monitor.

We have seen a couple of cases where the OS pauses the process for ~10-30 seconds, and GC logs or GC metrics do not show any activity. OS can pause the process for various reasons swap, or bad disk drivers.
Also observed non-GC caused pause in our online RS logs, so one more +1 from me for adding the metrics. Thanks.

No magic to JvmPauseMonitor. If it is seeing pauses that are not in GC, that is interesting. On article, how you think blocked i/o would manifest in the GC log? Wouldn't the timestamps be just off? Just trying to avoid double metric on same base phenomenon.

You running an hbase cluster now Nick Dimiduk If so, i defer to your operator self... don't mind my dev BS.
+1 for this. Now we grep this log and post it to OpenTSDB

We see JvmPauseMonitor alerts quite frequently that aren't GC related, and end up tracking them separately. Agree exporting a separate metric is useful. (We collect and parse GC logs so can see when there's a GC pause beyond the threshold concurrent with a JvmPauseMonitor alert, or not.)
Actually I can take this if nobody else wants it.

Actually I can take this if nobody else wants it.

Thanks Andrew Purtell!

Patch which introduces JvmPauseMonitorSource, a new interface for hooking up the pause monitor to various metrics sources. Currently only MetricsRegionServerSource implements it. After this patch goes in I'll extend MetricsRESTSource (HBASE-15662), MetricsThriftServerSource (HBASE-15663), and HMaster in 0.98 only (HBASE-15661) in the same way.

Those unit test failures are not mine but let me look at the checkstyle and whitespace results and get back with another patch.

I kind of like the idea of mixing this in to the server sources, so the pause metrics appear in their JMX hierarchy, but could also make this standalone like MetricsWAL. Any preference? If not I'll fix any checkstyle and whitespace issues Monday.

I kind of like the idea of mixing this in to the server sources, so the pause metrics appear in their JMX hierarchy, but could also make this standalone like MetricsWAL. Any preference?

Is it worth sharing the implementation? In any case, we need to differentiate the JVM pause metrics for RS / Rest or Thrift based on the server type. If not, the approach in the patch seems fine.
+1.

In any case, we need to differentiate the JVM pause metrics for RS / Rest or Thrift based on the server type.If not, the approach in the patch seems fine. +1.

Thanks Enis.
Patch fixing line length and whitespace issues
Start the pause monitor after the metrics server source is created.
Patch for 0.98 (needed for HBASE-15661)

I kind of like the idea of mixing this in to the server sources, so the pause metrics appear in their JMX hierarchy, but could also make this standalone like MetricsWAL. Any preference?

Mixed in with the other server-level metrics makes sense to me. How would that impact its use for consumers? I'm thinking about whether tcollector would automatically pick up the new metric.

I'm thinking about whether tcollector would automatically pick up the new metric.

Yes, there will be two new counters and two new histograms included in the server source metrics, that will be transmitted/processed with the rest. Any existing setup to record server source metrics will get them.
Updated patches fixing checkstyle nits in JvmPauseMonitorSource.

Going to commit this today
I plan on committing the whole work, including subtasks, so please take a look and let me know if you have any objections
